item.title: SLB赢得穆特里巴油田开发下一阶段15亿美元合同
item.description: 油田服务供应商斯伦贝谢公司周二宣布，科威特石油公司已授予其一份为期五年、价值15亿美元的综合合同，负责科威特穆特里巴油田的生产设计、开发及管理。【原文：Oilfield services provider SLB said on Tuesday that Kuwait Oil Company has awarded it a five-year, $1.5 billion integrated contract to design, develop and manage production at the Mutriba field in Kuwait.】

item.title: 博罗瑞吉上调年度盈利预期，得益于投资者沟通业务表现强劲
item.description: 金融科技公司布罗德里奇金融周二上调全年盈利预期，并公布第二季度利润增长，其投资者通讯业务的强劲表现为公司业绩提供了支撑。【原文：Fintech firm Broadridge Financial raised its full-year earnings forecast and posted a higher second-quarter profit on Tuesday, buoyed by strength in its investor communications business.】

item.title: 关于迪士尼新任首席执行官乔希·达马罗的五个关键信息
item.description: 华特迪士尼公司周二任命主题公园业务负责人乔什·达马罗为首席执行官，接替长期掌舵的鲍勃·艾格。在此媒体整合时代，这家娱乐巨头正经历从传统电视向流媒体的转型。【原文：Walt Disney tapped theme-parks chief Josh D'Amaro as CEO on Tuesday, succeeding long-time head Bob Iger as the entertainment giant navigates the shift from linear television to streaming in an era of media consolidation.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称摩根大通即将推出新兴市场本地货币债券新指数
item.description: 摩根大通正敲定一项新指数计划，该指数将追踪前沿市场本地货币债券。知情投资者向路透社透露，该行此举旨在满足投资者对风险更高、更具多样性的高收益债券日益增长的需求。【原文：JPMorgan is finalising plans for a new index to track frontier market local currency bonds, investors consulted on the details told Reuters, as the bank looks to satisfy a growing appetite for riskier and more diversified high-yield debt.】

item.title: 西部数据增持40亿美元回购计划，人工智能推动内存芯片销量增长
item.description: 西部数据周二表示，其董事会已批准额外40亿美元用于股票回购，因其用于人工智能服务器的内存芯片需求激增。【原文：Western Digital said on Tuesday its board has approved $4 billion more for share repurchases, as demand for its memory chips used in artificial intelligence servers surges.】

item.title: 迪士尼任命主题公园负责人乔希·达马罗为首席执行官，引领后艾格时代
item.description: 华特迪士尼公司周二任命主题公园业务负责人乔希·达马罗为首席执行官，结束了长达数年的继任不确定性。在人工智能浪潮与行业整合浪潮颠覆媒体产业之际，这家老牌娱乐巨头将掌舵权交给了资深内部人士。【原文：Walt Disney on Tuesday named theme parks head Josh D'Amaro as CEO, ending years of succession uncertainty and placing a longtime insider at the helm as artificial intelligence and a wave of consolidation upend the media industry.】

item.title: 马士基、赫伯罗特将恢复部分红海航线，由海军护航
item.description: 马士基周二表示，航运集团赫伯罗特和马士基将通过其共享服务网络，于本月恢复部分经红海和苏伊士运河的运输航线。【原文：Shipping groups Hapag-Lloyd and Maersk will resume some transit routes through the Red Sea and the Suez Canal this month under their shared services network, Maersk said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 希腊政府消息人士称，该国即将宣布禁止15岁以下儿童使用社交媒体
item.description: 希腊政府高级消息人士周二向路透社透露，该国即将宣布禁止15岁以下儿童使用社交媒体。【原文：Greece is "very close" to announcing a social media ban for children aged under 15, a senior government source told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: Hubbell季度利润因数据中心产品需求强劲而上升
item.description: 周二公布的财报显示，得益于数据中心对其电气设备的需求强劲，Hubbell公司第四季度利润实现增长。【原文：Hubbell posted a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday, helped by strong demand for its electrical equipment from data centers.】

item.title: KCC将冬季风暴造成的保险损失定为67亿美元
item.description: 灾难风险建模公司凯伦·克拉克公司周二表示，近期冬季风暴造成的私人保险损失估计为67亿美元。【原文：Privately insured losses from the recent winter storm are estimated to be $6.7 billion, catastrophe risk modeling firm Karen Clark and Company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 高德纳预测咨询部门因需求放缓将出现低迷年度业绩
item.description: IT研究公司高德纳周二预测，其年度营收和利润将低于华尔街预期，因企业缩减开支导致对该公司咨询服务的需求减弱。【原文：IT research firm Gartner on Tuesday forecast annual revenue and earnings below Wall Street expectations, as enterprises scaling back their spending dampened demand for its consulting services.】

item.title: 美联储巴金：降息措施迄今支撑就业市场，静待通胀"最后一公里"
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会迄今的降息举措，在帮助保障就业市场健康的同时，也助力美联储完成将通胀率回归至央行2%目标的"最后一公里"。里士满联储主席汤姆·巴金周二如是表示。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts so far have helped insure the health of the job market while the Fed tries to complete "the last mile" in returning inflation to the central bank's 2% target, Richmond Fed President Tom Barkin said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家：伊朗加密货币活动激增引发美国关注
item.description: 美国调查人员正在审查特定加密货币平台是否曾协助伊朗官员规避制裁，一位区块链研究员向路透社透露。当前，加密货币活动在伊朗伊斯兰共和国呈现蓬勃发展态势。【原文：U.S. investigators are examining whether specific crypto platforms have facilitated sanctions evasion by Iranian officials, a blockchain researcher told Reuters, as cryptocurrency activity booms in the Islamic Republic.】

item.title: 美联储官员米兰向福克斯商业频道表示，他仍希望今年降息
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬·米兰周二在接受福克斯商业频道采访时，继续为今年央行大幅降息的必要性进行辩护。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran continued to make the case for aggressive central bank interest rate cuts this year, in an interview on Fox Business Network on Tuesday.】

item.title: 马斯克旗下SpaceX收购xAI后，巨额IPO成为焦点
item.description: 埃隆·马斯克旗下的SpaceX公司已收购其人工智能初创企业xAI。此次交易通过将火箭与卫星公司与Grok聊天机器人的制造商合并，实现了这位亿万富翁在人工智能与太空领域的雄心壮志。【原文：Elon Musk's SpaceX has acquired his artificial intelligence startup xAI in a deal that unifies the billionaire's AI and space ambitions by combining the rocket-and-satellite company with the maker of the Grok chatbot.】

item.title: 人工智能担忧重创欧洲软件股
item.description: 欧洲软件、数据分析和广告公司股价周二加速下跌，因更新版人工智能模型引发市场对现有企业能否捍卫其商业模式的新疑虑，凸显该技术对曾被视为人工智能受益者的行业构成的颠覆性威胁。【原文：A sell-off in European software, data analytics and advertising companies accelerated on Tuesday, as updated artificial intelligence models raised fresh doubts about whether incumbent firms can defend their business models, underscoring the technology's disruptive threat to sectors once viewed as AI winners.】

item.title: 电网延迟阻碍亚马逊在欧洲的数据中心扩张
item.description: 亚马逊向路透社透露，电力网接入的长期延误正对其在欧洲扩建数据中心的计划构成挑战。与此同时，各行业正加大对政策制定者的压力，要求升级老化的能源电网。【原文：Long delays to get power grid connections are challenging Amazon's plans to expand data centers in Europe, the company told Reuters, as industries ramp up pressure on policymakers to upgrade ageing energy grids.】

item.title: 英国隐私监管机构对Grok展开调查
item.description: 英国隐私监管机构周二正式启动对埃隆·马斯克旗下Grok聊天机器人的调查，重点关注其个人数据处理方式及其可能生成有害性化图像和视频内容的风险。【原文：Britain's privacy watchdog on Tuesday launched a formal investigation into Elon Musk's Grok chatbot over the processing of personal data and its potential to produce harmful sexualised images and video content.】

item.title: 迈克尔·科尔斯母公司Capri上调年度营收预期
item.description: 卡普里控股公司周二上调了年度营收预期，其旗下Jimmy Choo和Michael Kors两大品牌对服装及手袋的稳定需求成为支撑依据。【原文：Capri Holdings on Tuesday raised its annual revenue forecast, banking on steady demand for apparel and handbags across its Jimmy Choo and Michael Kors brands.】

item.title: 惠普任命布鲁斯·布鲁萨德为临时首席执行官
item.description: 惠普公司周二宣布任命布鲁斯·布鲁萨德为公司临时首席执行官，该任命即刻生效。【原文：HP Inc on Tuesday named Bruce Broussard as the company's interim chief executive officer effective immediately.】

item.title: PayPal任命恩里克·洛雷斯为首席执行官
item.description: PayPal周二宣布任命恩里克·洛雷斯为总裁兼首席执行官，任命将于3月1日生效。【原文：PayPal said on Tuesday it has named Enrique Lores as president and CEO, effective March 1.】

item.title: PayPal预计2026年利润低于预期，任命恩里克·洛雷斯为首席执行官
item.description: PayPal周二发布了2026年利润预期，表现平平，其第四季度财报数据低于华尔街预期。公司业绩承压源于美国零售支出疲软，以及其自有支付业务板块增长放缓。【原文：PayPal issued a lackluster profit forecast for 2026 and reported fourth-quarter earnings below Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, pressured by weaker U.S. retail spending and slower growth in its branded checkout segment.】

item.title: 辉瑞业绩超预期，老药需求抵消新冠业务下滑
item.description: 辉瑞周二公布的第四季度财报超出华尔街预期，这得益于抗凝血药艾乐妥等老牌药品的持续需求，抵消了新冠相关产品销售下滑的影响。【原文：Pfizer on Tuesday reported fourth-quarter earnings above Wall Street estimates, as sustained demand for older drugs such as blood thinner Eliquis helped offset fading sales of its COVID products.】

item.title: WTW因风险管理和经纪业务强劲表现超出盈利预期
item.description: 保险经纪公司WTW周二公布的第四季度利润超出华尔街预期，其风险与经纪业务的强劲表现是主要推动因素。【原文：Insurance broker WTW beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday, driven by a strong performance in its risk and brokerage business.】

item.title: 晨间竞标：交易与延迟
item.description: 当今美国及全球市场中真正重要的因素【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: ARKO石油公司寻求在美国IPO中获得高达9.1亿美元的估值
item.description: 燃料分销商ARKO石油公司周二表示，其在美国首次公开募股（IPO）中寻求高达9.1亿美元的估值。【原文：ARKO Petroleum is seeking a valuation of as much as $910 million in its U.S. initial public offering, the fuel distributor said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 马拉松石油公司利润超预期，因利润率从多年低点回升
item.description: 马拉松石油公司周二公布的第四季度利润超出华尔街预期，炼油利润率飙升44%凸显其运营表现强劲，此前该公司经历了2024年持续低迷的经营状态。【原文：Marathon Petroleum reported fourth-quarter profit above Wall Street estimate on Tuesday, as a 44% jump in refining margins underscored stronger operational performance after a prolonged downturn in 2024.】

item.title: 默克公司预测2026年销售额将低于预期，因专利到期导致收入减少
item.description: 默克公司周二预测，2026年的销售额和利润将低于华尔街预期，因为糖尿病药物Januvia及其他药品专利保护期的丧失将比分析师预期的更具冲击力。【原文：Merck & Co on Tuesday forecast 2026 sales and profits below Wall Street estimates as the loss of patent exclusivity on diabetes drug Januvia and other medicines will hit harder than analysts are projecting.】

item.title: 印度最高法院质疑WhatsApp与Meta旗下实体共享用户数据的政策
item.description: 印度最高法院周二警告称，可能重新禁止Meta旗下WhatsApp与集团其他实体共享数据，并指出该即时通讯应用的隐私政策误导了用户。两名出庭律师透露了这一消息。【原文：India's top court on Tuesday warned it could reimpose a ban on Meta-owned WhatsApp's data sharing with other group entities, saying the messaging app's privacy policy misled users, two lawyers present in court said.】

item.title: 马斯克旗下SpaceX与xAI以1.25万亿美元估值完成合并，美国航天股应声上涨
item.description: 周二，美国航天类股上涨，此前埃隆·马斯克宣布SpaceX与xAI合并，该交易对合并后实体的估值达1.25万亿美元，此举将大力推动地球外人工智能基础设施的建设。【原文：U.S. space stocks rose on Tuesday after Elon Musk announced the merger of SpaceX and xAI in a deal that valued the combined entity at $1.25 trillion, a major push to expand artificial intelligence infrastructure outside earth.】
